BEFORE START-UP.text: To open or close service hatches use “LCTRL+W” binding

Contact ground crew to re-arm and refuel as required by the mission. Via the ground crew interface, you can also select either the HMS (Helmet Mounted Sight) or NVG (Night Vision Goggles) loadout by pressing « \ », then pressing F8 (Ground Crew), and either F1 (HMS) or F2 (NVG).
For day operations, the Helmet-Mounted Sight is recommended.
Set cover UP, set switch UP, then set cover DOWN

BEFORE START-UP.requirement: Set R-828 VHF-1 Radio Power switch
Set R-800 VHF-2 Radio Power switch

BEFORE START-UP.text: Set cover UP, set switch DOWN, then set cover DOWN
This switch  provides power to EKRAN Warning System, hydraulics, and transmission group control sensors
We will perform an Accelerated Alignment of INU (Inertial Navigation Unit) and K-041 targeting system, which should take approx. 3 to 4 minutes.

BEFORE START-UP.requirement: Set INU (Inertial Navigation Unit) Heat Switch
Set ABRIS (AMMS, Advanced Moving Map System) Power switch

BEFORE START-UP.text: While navigation systems, the Heads-Up Display (HUD) and targeting systems are powering up, the HUD will display the symbol “ИКВ/УВ” and the overhead panel will display the “HUD NO READY” caution.
After approx. 3 minutes, the accelerated INU (Inertial Navigation Unit) alignment process should be completed.
The “ИКВ/УВ” (INU/AA) symbol will disappear from the HUD and the INU will switch to operational mode.
The flashing indicator lights on the Flight Mode Control Panel labelled К, Т,Нwill switch off
The alarm flag labelled КС will disappear from the HSI, which will then display the heading values taken from the onboard computer
The alarm flag labelled АГ will disappear from the INU, which will then display the aircraft’s parking roll and pitch values.
Set cover UP, set switch to OPER, then set cover DOWN
Flip cover UP, set three switches UP, flip cover DOWN

APU START.action: (UP, just prior to lifting the metal guard).

APU START.requirement: Set Forward and Aft fuel pumps
Set Left (Fwd), right (Aft) and APU fuel tank shutoff valves

APU START.text: Set cover UP, set switch UP, then set cover DOWN

APU START.requirement: Set Left and Right EEG (Electronic Engine Governor) switches

APU START.text: Set cover UP, set switch to ON, then set cover DOWN
Once the APU is started, the air pressure generated by it will be used to drive the engine pneumatic starter.
APU start is completed within about 20-30 seconds in normal temperature conditions, but can take up to 1 minute in very cold conditions.
Once APU is running/operational APU EGT (Exhaust Gas Temperature) should stabilize to approx.600 deg C (no more than 720 deg C)
APU OIL P NORM indication should be illuminated
APU ON indication should be illuminated as well.
APU warm up, with no air bleeding, should take one minute before using it for main engine starts.

ENGINE START.action: Press START button for 2-3 sec. START VLV light indicates the start valve is open.

ENGINE START.requirement: When Left Engine’s Gas Generator Speed reaches 20 % RPM
ENGINE START.action: open LEFT engine shutoff valve (left red lever UP)

ENGINE START.text: Confirm EGT (Exhaust Gas Temperature), engine oil pressure and transmission gearbox oil pressure increase. Monitor oil temperature accordingly.
Rotors motion should initiate at Gas Generator RPM of no more than 25% (visual confirmation by looking at the nearest blade)
Starter will disengage at Gas Generator RPM between 60 and65%. Monitor this with the START light going off.
Confirm that hydraulic fluid pressure increases in all systems.

ENGINE START.action: Press START button for 2-3 sec. START VLV light indicates the start valve is open.

ENGINE START.requirement: When Right Engine’s Gas Generator Speed reaches 20 %RPM
ENGINE START.action: open RIGHT engine shutoff valve (right red lever UP)

ENGINE START.text: Confirm EGT (Exhaust Gas Temperature), engine oil pressure increase. Monitor oil temperature accordingly.
Starter will disengage at Gas Generator RPM between 60and 65%. Monitor this with the START light going off.
Verify that Rotor Speed stabilizes around 95-100 % RPM.

ENGINE START.requirement: When Right Engine’s Gas Generator Speed stabilizes over 60 % RPM
ENGINE START.action: set Turbo Gear/APU/Left Engine/Right Engine switch to central position

ENGINE START.requirement: When both engines are at IDLE power or above
Set APU fuel tank shutoff valve

ENGINE START.text: Set cover UP, set switch DOWN, then set cover DOWN

AFTER START-UP.requirement: Set LEFT and RIGHT AC Generators

AFTER START-UP.text: If Helmet-Mounted Sight (HMS) display appears and you want to stow it, press “H” toggle it.

AFTER START-UP.requirement: Set Engine Dust Protection system switch

AFTER START-UP.text: Only if required since it decreases available engine power.

AFTER START-UP.requirement: Set L-140 Laser Warning Receiver power switch
BANK (K), PITCH (T) and HDG HOLD/YAW (H) stability augmentation channels
Set Interior and Exterior Light Switches
Access the ODS (Onboard Defence System) Page on the ABRIS
AFTER START-UP.action: press the button next to NAV/ARC/HSI repeatedly until you access the ODS page.

AFTER START-UP.text: Once the aircraft has been powered up and the generators are online, the power-up sequence of the ODS (Onboard Defence System) starts automatically.
Whenever the ODS system is switched on, it must first undergo a 3-minute long built-in test prior to normal operation with the sign "ODS NOT READY" shown in upper-right corner of the ABRIS ODS page
After “ODS NOT READY” message, “MWS NOT READY” (Missile Warning System) is shown during MWS power-up sequence.
Once ODS built-in test is complete, the Onboard Defence system goes in “ODSSTANDBY” since this is the Onboard Defence System Switch position by default.
To access the NAV page.; Press the button next to MENU repeatedly
ODS ON (ODS Switch UP): Countermeasure system will automatically deploy flares if a missile is heading your way.
STANDBY (ODS Switch DOWN): Countermeasure system will not automatically deploy flares if a missile is heading your way.

TAXI.action: Gently tilt the cyclic forward while increasing the pitch of the main rotors with the collective.

TAXI.requirement: Steer the helicopter on the ground
TAXI.action: anti-torque pedals in the direction of turn.
inputs to the cyclic and the wheel brakes.

HOVER.text: Reactive moments of a coaxial-rotor are compensated for by the counter-rotational forces cancelling out each other.
The coaxial-rotors' reactive moments are compensated automatically throughout the flight, thus requiring little input compensation by the pilot.

HOVER.requirement: To stay cantered and avoid drifting
Your stick can be trimmed to a hover position.
HOVER.action: Hold the “FORCE TRIM” button (on your cyclic).

HOVER.text: Anticipate the rotorcraft’s reaction when you trim. Keep in mind that trim works a bit differently from a plane’s trimming.

TAKEOFF.text: Check that all your engine gauges (RPM, pressure &temperature) are within nominal parameters
Check to see if all your flight instruments all set up properly
Once you have performed a hover check and are lined up with the runway centreline, you are ready for takeoff

TAKEOFF.requirement: Settle the helicopter into a 5-10 meters hover
TAKEOFF.action: Increase the collective and compensate with the cyclic.

TAKEOFF.text: Keep accelerating and you will start generating more and more translational lift, naturally climbing.
Try to maintain an airspeed of 100-120 km/h when climbing.

VISUAL LANDING.requirement: Fly towards a reference point on the runway.

VISUAL LANDING.text: Maintain 100-120 km/h for a descent rate between 3 and 5 m/s3.

VISUAL LANDING.action: Turn on the Dust Protection switch.

VISUAL LANDING.requirement: You should reach your reference point in a 10m hover
VISUAL LANDING.action: Use your cyclic to come to a full stop

VISUAL LANDING.requirement: Once you have come to a full stop in a 10m hover
VISUAL LANDING.action: deploy landing gear and then you can slowly reduce collective to safely land on the ground
